      • crossProduct

        public static int crossProduct(int x1,
               int y1,
               int x2,
               int y2)
              determine the cross product and return negative number if the 2nd
      set of values, p1, are clockwise from the first, p1, w.r.t. origin (0,0).

          o P2
          .
          .
          .   o P1      <--- P2 is counterclockwise from P1
          .
          0

                o P2
                .
        P1 o    .       <--- P2 is clockwise from P1
                .
                .
                0
        Parameters:
        x1 -
        y1 -
        x2 -
        y2 -
        Returns:

        public static double[] intersectionOf2Lines(float x1,
                            float y1,

                            float x3,

                            float x4,
                            float y4)
        from http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Line-line_intersection

              (x1, y1)

                    \    (x4, y4)
                     \      *
                      \    /
                       \  /
                        \/
                      P /\
                       /  \
                      /    \
                     /      \
        \
              (x3, y3)        \
                               \

                            (x2, y2)
           
        

        Parameters:
        x1 - 
        y1 - 
        x2 - 
        y2 - 
        x3 - 
        y3 - 
        x4 - 
        y4 - 
        

        Returns:
        the intersection of the 2 lines as a 2 item double array holding xTopPolygon then yTopPolygon, else
 if lines do not intersect, will return null;

        • 

      




        

      • 

        angleBetweenPointAndLine
        

        public static double angleBetweenPointAndLine(float x0,
                              float y0,
                              float x1,
                              float y1,
                              float xPoint,
                              float yPoint,
                              boolean calculateClockWise)
        

               For Clockwise, solving theta = C in diagram below.
       For Counter Clockwise, solving theta = A in diagram below.

                         (xp, yp)

                          .
              side c    .  \/.             Law of cosines
                      .    B               c^2 = a^2 + b^2 - 2ab cos C
                    .         .            or  a^2 = b^2 + c^2 - 2bc cos A
                  .
                .              . side a
       (x0,y0)*  _\A
                  .             .
                      .
                          .      .
                  side b      . C/
(x1,y1)

         Right triangle cosine and sine
           r /
            /
           /theta    xTopPolygon = r * cos(theta)
          -------
             xTopPolygon
     
        

        Parameters:
        x0 - 
        y0 - 
        x1 - 
        y1 - 
        xPoint - 
        yPoint - 
        calculateClockWise - 
        

        Returns:
        the angle between the edge 0:1 and edge 1:Point which is C for Clockwise, else A for Counter Clockwise

      • 

        createPolygonOfTopFWFractionMax
        

        public static ArrayPair createPolygonOfTopFWFractionMax(float[] x,
                                        float[] y,
                                        float topFraction)
        

        create an interpolated polygon of area around the peak for the top full width topFraction of max
 immediately surrounding the peak.
 For example, this is used to find the centroid of the peak of a Generalized Extreme Value distribution.
        

        Parameters:
        x - 
        y - 
        topFraction - 
        

        Returns:
